description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftlk1","text":"Methods to measure performance characteristics of carbon fiber electrodes for neurochemical recording are described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research (MJFF) and the Aligning Science Across Parkinson’s (ASAP) initiative
William N. and Bernice E. Bumpus Foundation

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d2fms","text":"An integrated system of hardware and software capable of recording dopamine signals up to 16 channels simultaneously using fast scan cyclic voltammetry (FSCV) was built with off-the-shelf electronics and a PC based data acquisition system. Guidance on constructing this system, including the circuit board layout as well as the MATLAB software for visualizing dopamine recording in real-time can be found on the GitHub Repository (https://github.com/hschwerdt/multifscv). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":431,"length":38}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"00DAABFDD88711EDBD640A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/hschwerdt/multifscv"}}}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"f150f","text":"Schwerdt, H. N. et al. Cellular-scale probes enable stable chronic subsecond monitoring of dopamine neurochemicals in a rodent model. Commun Biol, 1–11 (2018).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":134,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"caal","text":"Each carbon fiber (CF) electrode was tested in vitro in a beaker containing 0.9% sodium chloride saline to determine its functional properties (i.e., background current and noise) before soldering to another circuit board. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afdhq","text":"In vitro testing was performed in a Faraday cage to minimize electromagnetic interference (EMI) during test recording. A custom designed printed circuit board adapter was used to temporarily attach and connect up to 16 electrodes for testing in parallel, in some tests.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7966e","text":"Electrodes were determined to be suitable for in vivo recording if they met both of the following 2 criteria: (1) current noise \u003c 0.05 nA, and (2) magnitude of background current was in the range of 500 – 800 nA, which corresponds, respectively, to the limit of detection and the sensitivity to dopamine, as established previously.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":46,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ceqn","text":"In instances in which the magnitude of background current was above 800 nA, a steel razor blade was used to trim the tip of the exposed CF slightly and then the electrode was retested.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32j3a","text":"The trimming and test process was repeated until the final background current was in the target range of 500 – 800 nA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kqu6","text":"Electrodes were determined to be nonfunctional and would not be trimmed if they met any of the following 2 criteria: (1) a mechanical break of the electrode along its shaft or etched tip that resulted in a measurement of background current less than 100 nA, or (2) a perforation of the electrode that resulted in current noise ≥ 0.05 nA or background current saturation (magnitude of background current at any potential ≥ 2000 nA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4il3s","text":"Electrodes were inserted into the beaker and connected to the FSCV headstage for recording current. An Ag/AgCl reference electrode was also inserted in the beaker to serve as a current return and voltage reference. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: In Vitro FSCV Testing of Carbon Fiber Electrodes to Characterize Functional Operation in Dopamine Detection
title_html: In Vitro FSCV Testing of Carbon Fiber Electrodes to Characterize Functional Operation in Dopamine Detection
